result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Kendrell Anthony

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Robert Kendrell Anthony in court.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V in court for Robert Kendrell Anthony.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for plea/sentencing hearing. Case remains in resolution posture. Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Robert Kendrell Anthony in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requeste plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 11.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Robert Kendrell Anthony in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties continue negotiations.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
SIGNED order appointing counsel at county expense filed.

5/24/2022 ENTRY: The court appointed Atty. Joseph Bastien to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $*** per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $*** per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after.

CORRECTION: The court appointed Atty. Joseph Bastien to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $150.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after.

Defendant Robert Kendrell Anthony in court, appear b video with attorney Joseph P Bastien, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 3, 2022 - received

Defendant Robert Kendrell Anthony in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court conducted Indigency Hearing.Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Joseph Bastien to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $*** per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $*** per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 3 for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Robert Kendrell Anthony in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for an indigency hearing in Branch 28.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/18/22 @ 1:30p
